snippet: With 50,000 new H.I.V. cases each year in the United States, government advisers said Truvada, an antiviral medicine, should be approved for use in healthy people at high risk of infection.
abstract: Advisory panel to the Food and Drug Administration recommends that Truvada, a drug already used to treat HIV infection, should be approved to prevent it; it is the first time that government advisers have advocated giving antiviral medicine to healthy people who might be exposed through sexual activity to the virus that causes AIDS.
lead_paragraph: With 50,000 new H.I.V. cases each year in the United States, government advisers said Truvada, an antiviral medicine, should be approved for use in healthy people at high risk of infection.

headline.seo: F.D.A. Panel Backs Preventive Use of H.I.V. Drug Truvada
